articlesSectionCtaDescription: Book flights with a stopover in Dubai
itineraries.414777.tips.414775.descripti: For an authentic Arabian experience, head to the souks to haggle for bargains on perfumes, spices, textiles, gold and other souvenirs. These bustling markets are the heart of the old city
itineraries.414777.tips.414775.title: Explore the souks
itineraries.414777.tips.414776.descripti: Dubai Mall is the largest in the world, home to over 200 of the world’s most famous brands. Treat yourself to a whole new holiday wardrobe right here!
itineraries.414777.tips.414776.title: Visit the mall
itineraries.414777.tips.439222.descripti: As well as Dubai Mall, there’s both the Mall of the Emirates and the Dubai Marina Mall to enjoy. Both have a wide selection of pretty much everything: clothes, electronics, toys, art, books and more
itineraries.414777.tips.439222.title: Shop 'til you drop
itineraries.414777.tips.439223.descripti: The Satwa District is a bustling shopping district popular with residents of the city. Here’s where you come for traditional tailoring and fabrics, as well as food stalls and restaurants offering a wide variety of delicious cuisine
itineraries.414777.tips.439223.title: Mingle with the locals
itineraries.414777.tips.439224.descripti: As well as shops, the Mall of the Emirates contains a cinema, bowling alley and, incredibly, an indoor ski slope! The Dubai Mall also offers visitors the chance to learn the secrets of the deep in the form of a vast aquarium and underwater zoo
itineraries.414777.tips.439224.title: Epic entertainment
itineraries.414777.tips.439227.descripti: The Beach isn’t only a beach, but an area for food lovers with dining from around the globe, a shopping promenade, an outdoor gym and, of course, an area to simply relax after all that retail therapy
itineraries.414777.tips.439227.title: Chill at The Beach
itineraries.414777.tips.439228.descripti: Of course, the Dubai Marina Mall offers shops and restaurants like any other, but it also includes something you might not expect: from one of the Amwaj Towers one kilometre away, you can arrive at the terrace of the mall at 80 km/h on a zipline!
itineraries.414777.tips.439228.title: Finish with a thrill
itineraries.414777.title: Shopping on the go
itineraries.414791.tips.414790.descripti: Hop on an abra, a water taxi, and cross the busy Dubai Creek. There are two short routes to choose from, and from both you’ll see the minarets and towers of the Old Town, and the sparkling modern city. Otherwise, you can hire your own for an hour to explore the river further
itineraries.414791.tips.414790.title: Get on the water
itineraries.414791.tips.439231.descripti: Such an international city naturally has many world-class restaurants, but for some local flavour, try a walking tour of the best Arabian street food Dubai has to offer
itineraries.414791.tips.439231.title: A feast for foodies
itineraries.414791.tips.439232.descripti: At the Sheikh Mohammed Centre for Cultural Understanding, you’ll learn about Islamic and Emirati culture through guided mosque visits, discussions over tea, dates and pastries, and an open and welcoming attitude to all
itineraries.414791.tips.439232.title: Understand the culture
itineraries.414791.tips.439233.descripti: For generations, locals have bought and sold spices, silks, perfumes, gold and more in these fragrant, colourful markets. Just follow your nose!
itineraries.414791.tips.439233.title: Explore the souks
itineraries.414791.tips.439234.descripti: Built in 1787, the Al Fahidi Fort is the oldest building in the city. Fitting, then, that it should house the Dubai Museum, a collection of artefacts and exhibits that explore how life was here, before the discovery of oil changed everything
itineraries.414791.tips.439234.title: Learn the history
itineraries.414791.tips.439235.descripti: A flower garden is a treat for the senses, and Dubai’s more than most. More than 50 million flowers fill this vast area, as well as there being a butterfly park, peacocks strutting around, and a special aromatic garden
itineraries.414791.tips.439235.title: Fabulous flowers
itineraries.414791.tips.439236.descripti: The Dubai Fountain is illuminated with 6,600 lights and 25 projectors, making its nightly displays the largest in the world. Accompanied by classical and contemporary Arabic and world music, the spectacular performances are visible from everywhere around the lake promenade
itineraries.414791.tips.439236.title: The art of water
itineraries.414791.title: Colours, sounds and flavours
itineraries.439245.tips.439238.descripti: The Aquaventure Waterpark is located at The Palm Jumeirah, the huge artificial archipelago that’s become one of the symbols of Dubai. Rides, slides, lagoons and pools make up this outdoor playground, with activities for water-lovers of all ages
itineraries.439245.tips.439238.title: Splash-tacular!
itineraries.439245.tips.439239.descripti: Dubai Mall isn’t just a shopping centre, it also houses an enormous aquarium and underwater zoo with thousands of species of sea-life, from rays to sharks and more!
itineraries.439245.tips.439239.title: Creatures of the deep
itineraries.439245.tips.439240.descripti: What’s the least likely thing you could do in Dubai? If you said ski, you’d be wrong! At the Emirates Mall, the Ski Dubai slope is for experts and novices alike, and even comes with its very own colony of penguins! For something more sedate, there’s ice-skating on offer at Dubai Mall
itineraries.439245.tips.439240.title: Ski and skate
itineraries.439245.tips.439241.descripti: Getting out of the city, there are tours of the surrounding desert in 4x4s, along with dune surfing, quad biking and, if you go in the evenings, the possibility of a barbecue under the stars featuring delicious traditional Arabian food
itineraries.439245.tips.439241.title: Desert adventures
itineraries.439245.tips.439242.descripti: The world’s largest indoor theme park at IMG Worlds of Adventure features four Epic Zones featuring Marvel characters, Cartoon Network favourites and animatronic dinosaurs, as well as enough wild rides to keep you entertained for hours
itineraries.439245.tips.439242.title: Rollercoaster mayhem!
itineraries.439245.tips.439243.descripti: KidZania is an entire city run by children. That’s right, an entire town in miniature in which kids role-play the jobs of adults, working and earning currency to spend on gifts and activities, as well as taking turns to help govern the town
itineraries.439245.tips.439243.title: Put the kids in charge
itineraries.439245.tips.439244.descripti: For some more high-octane thrills, this is the place to be. The fabulous Dubai Kartdrome offers a simple arrive-and-drive programme for adults, as well as kids aged 7 and above
itineraries.439245.tips.439244.title: Pedal to the metal
itineraries.439245.title: Family fun
itineraries.439256.tips.439254.descripti: On Fridays, many of the city’s luxury restaurants offer a champagne brunch buffet, often with unlimited champagne and tables of steak, seafood and the finest hors d’oeuvres from around the world. It’s an indulgence like no other
itineraries.439256.tips.439254.title: Champagne brunch
itineraries.439256.tips.439255.descripti: The gold souk is where you can get a taste of traditional Emirati culture, and is also somewhere you can buy gold jewellery you can virtually guarantee no-one else will have. It’s the hub of the Middle East’s jewellery industry with over 250 traders
itineraries.439256.tips.439255.title: Go for gold
itineraries.439256.tips.439270.descripti: Jumeirah Beach is a stretch of coastline perfect for simply lying back and de-stressing on the sand or on a sun lounger. If you’d like to watch other people doing things while you don’t, Kite Beach is home to the best surfing, kite-surfing or swimming
itineraries.439256.tips.439270.title: Relax in the sun
itineraries.439256.tips.439271.descripti: All that relaxing can be hard work, so why not treat yourself to a spa treatment? There are scores of world-class spas in the city, each giving a wide variety of treatments for a range of prices. After all, you’ve earned it!
itineraries.439256.tips.439271.title: Pamper yourself
itineraries.439256.tips.439272.descripti: The Jumeirah Beach Residence contains a section called, simply, The Walk. It’s a beachfront promenade combining shopping, fine dining and pavement cafes. Sip a cocktail or a coffee as you watch the elegant world go by
itineraries.439256.tips.439272.title: Explore the JBR
itineraries.439256.tips.439273.descripti: Dubai is rightfully famous for its shopping malls; giant, sprawling temples to some of the most well-known designers, brands and goods in the world, all under one air-conditioned roof
itineraries.439256.tips.439273.title: Shop ’til you drop
itineraries.439256.tips.439274.descripti: The Burj Khalifa is the world’s tallest building, and there’s no better time to visit than at sunset. Ascend to the 125th floor (or the 148th if you want to pay a bit more) and marvel at the spectacular vistas
itineraries.439256.tips.439274.title: A view like no other
itineraries.439256.title: Live like a celebrity
itineraries.439277.tips.439276.descripti: The largest choreographed fountain in the world can be found in the Burj Khalifa Lake in the centre of the Downtown area. Its nightly displays are a captivating mix of lights, projections, classical and contemporary music and, naturally, an awful lot of water
itineraries.439277.tips.439276.title: Fabulous fountains
itineraries.439277.tips.439278.descripti: The Burj Khalifa is the tallest building in the world, so don’t miss the chance to say you’ve been up there! Zip up in the lifts to the viewing galleries and gaze out over one of the most amazing cities on the planet
itineraries.439277.tips.439278.title: Elevator to the skies
itineraries.439277.tips.439279.descripti: For a slightly different view of Dubai, head along to the Ain Eye Observation Wheel on Bluewaters Island. It’s the world’s tallest ferris wheel and will provide views back to the Burj Khalifa, the beaches and Palm Jumeirah
itineraries.439277.tips.439279.title: A new angle
itineraries.439277.tips.439280.descripti: Dubai is home to the world’s largest shopping mall, Dubai Mall, including not only hundreds of shops but an ice-rink and an aquarium as well. The Emirates Mall, incredibly, features a huge indoor ski slope, and the Dubai Marina Mall boasts a giant zipline!
itineraries.439277.tips.439280.title: Shopping with a twist
itineraries.439277.tips.439281.descripti: Spreading over 72,000 square metres, the Dubai Miracle Garden is a space where millions of flowers are grown and cultivated into the most beautiful – and unusual – displays. There are houses made of flowers, a giant floral clock… and you might even meet a peacock or two!
itineraries.439277.tips.439281.title: Nothing but flowers
itineraries.439277.tips.439282.descripti: Rising 150m over Zabeel Park, Dubai is home to a gigantic picture frame. Why? Why not? Visitors can ascend to the very top for more panoramic views and a glass-floored walkway, and from outside it’s an actual frame for views of the Burj Khalifa
itineraries.439277.tips.439282.title: Picture this
itineraries.439277.tips.439283.descripti: The size of 28 football pitches, the IMG Worlds of Adventure is the largest indoor theme park in the world. Spread over four differently themed zones, you can experience roller coasters and thrill-rides galore, as well as restaurants and shops if you need to calm down a bit
itineraries.439277.tips.439283.title: Endless thrills
itineraries.439277.title: Size is everything
mainActionButtonText: Save on your trip & see Dubai
mainDescription: There’s a world of experiences waiting on a 24-hour stopover in Dubai
mainTitle: Start your vacation with a holiday
metaDescription: Traveling to Thailand, Bali or Singapore? From Asia to London, New York or Barcelona? Visit Dubai on the way and start your vacation with a holiday.
metaTitle: Dubai Stopover | The best way to start a trip
